title: Reuben Casserole Recipe
description: This tasty Reuben casserole is made with layers of sauerkraut, corned beef, Swiss cheese, rye bread crumbs, and creamy Russian-style salad dressing.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Casserole Recipes Beef Reuben Casserole 4.6 (413) 333 Reviews 36 Photos This tasty Reuben casserole with layers of sauerkraut, corned beef, Swiss cheese, rye bread crumbs, and Russian-style salad dressing is like a baked deli sandwich in a dish. Submitted by JAMON0126 Updated on March 3, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 36 36 36 36 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 1 (9x13-inch) casserole Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 6 slices rye bread, cubed 1 (16 ounce) can sauerkraut, drained and rinsed 1 pound deli sliced corned beef, cut into strips ¾ cup Russian-style salad dressing cooking spray 2 cups shredded Swiss cheese Directions Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray. Spray one sheet of aluminum foil with cooking spray. Spread bread cubes in the bottom of the prepared casserole dish. Layer bread cubes with sauerkraut and beef strips, then pour dressing over top. Cover with the aluminum foil, sprayed-side down. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove and discard foil; sprinkle Swiss cheese over casserole. Continue baking until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 10 more minutes. I Made It Print 637 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Reuben Casserole 01 of 36 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS 02 of 36 Photo by  DREGINEK 01/14/2025 Wow!! Given how easy this is, this was delicious!! A few recommends; first - I went to my deli counter and asked them to slice a lb of corned beef but on the thicker side. I don’t know what a “#4” translates to in slicer worlds but when I cut into bite sized pieces, it was like each bite had a CB brisket I cooked and was using this recipe to use up leftovers. Second, I couldn’t decide on the bread but Pepperidge Farms has a pumpernickel and Rye swirl bread. This is best of both worlds! The loaf itself is a little smaller so used 7 slices. Finding Russian dressing was HARD! Wishbone was the only brand in my store that had it. Although I was skeptical- it WAS really good and I’m glad I found/used it vs Thousand Island. I layered a little differently; bread, meat, sauerkraut, a little Swiss and the dressing. Repeated but a little lighter on all the second go around. Could have used a little more sauerkraut and dressing and will add more next time. Added the rest of the Swiss - and maybe a little more than the recipe called for during the uncovered bake time. Did I mention this was delicious??!! Casseroles - while perfect weeknight meals - are not often regarded as highly as this one did. Great recipe JAMON0126!! We loved it! 03 of 36 Photo by  Ilhan Sharp 03/22/2024 Worth the effort Easy to follow Great flavors A keeper! This recipe is so delicious!! It was very good, the bread made it taste just like a reuben sandwich, and this recipe is full of wonderful flavor. I truly appreciate JAMON0126 for sharing this delightful recipe. I will be making this recipe again! 04 of 36 Photo by  Archer's Grams 02/13/2024 Made this casserole as posted with the following exception, used half corned beef on one side of the pan and half smoked turkey on the other for my non-red meat eaters, bread used was Deli Swirl (half rye, half pumpernickel). It was very easy to make and tasted good. It will go on my meal rotation list periodically for a change of pace taste. Thank you Jamon0126! 05 of 36 Photo by  UniqueHash2977 01/01/2024 It’s a new family favorite 06 of 36 Photo by  JumpyRind3386 10/26/2023 Tastes amazing my family loves this casserole and I plan to make it for them again !! Wonderful idea 07 of 36 Photo by  FlashyPeas3311 09/10/2023 It was delicious 😋The only thing different I did was toast my Rye bread and it stayed very crunchy. This is the first time I ever made this and I will definitely be making it again for get togethers. It was so easy. 08 of 36 Photo by  schultz351 03/30/2022 Deli didn't have corned beef, so used turkey. Used marble rye and thousand island dressing. Rachel or Reuben, either way will make again! 09 of 36 Photo by  Whatapeachlane 03/26/2022 I thought it was really good and easier than making Reuban’s. The only thing I did different was melt a couple Tbs of butter and coated the bread and toasted it first while my oven was preheating then added the sourcrout and other ingredients. Was really good. Perfect for left overs corned beef. 10 of 36 Photo by  DMD 08/11/2021 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Corned Beef Special Sandwiches 12 Ratings Hot Corned Beef and Cheese Sandwiches 1 Rating Broiled Reuben Sandwich 19 Ratings Irish Tacos 35 Ratings Reuben Sandwich 724 Ratings The Real Reuben 97 Ratings Reuben Crescent Bake 81 Ratings Red Reuben Hand Pies Simply Potatoes® Easy Shepherd's Pie 43 Ratings Shepherd's Pie 3,281 Ratings Easy English Cottage Pie 477 Ratings Mock Sliders 5 Ratings Reuben Pizza 122 Ratings Simple Shepherd's Pie 575 Ratings Loaded Reuben Totchos 4 Ratings Montreal Reuben Sandwich 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: JAMON0126
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray. Spray one sheet of aluminum foil with cooking spray.;Spread bread cubes in the bottom of the prepared casserole dish. Layer bread cubes with sauerkraut and beef strips, then pour dressing over top. Cover with the aluminum foil, sprayed-side down.;Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove and discard foil; sprinkle Swiss cheese over casserole. Continue baking until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 10 more minutes.
